articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry Spokesman Blasts U.S. and Vassal Forces for Faulting Service of DPRK Tourist Liner
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry Spokesman Blasts U.S. and Vassal Forces for Faulting Service of DPRK Tourist Liner
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA on May 23 over the fact that the U.S. and its vassal forces are faulting the service of Rajin-Vladivostok international tourist liner "Mangyongbong":
					 The Rajin-Vladivostok international tourist liner "Mangyongbong" has recently begun its service.
					
					 Its regular operation under an agreement between the DPRK and Russia will be able to contribute to developing the bilateral cooperation in the economic field such as sea transport and tourism.
					
					 This is a normal bilateral cooperation work aimed to expand the bilateral economic relations and deepen the friendship through humanitarian exchanges and visits.
					
					 However, the U.S. running amuck to ratchet up sanctions on the DPRK faulted even the service of the liner, a normal economic cooperation undertaking between the two sovereign states, with mobilization of its vassal forces, in a bid to prevent the DPRK-Russia economic cooperation and suffocate the DPRK through tightened economic blockade.
					
					 Such action is arousing a strong backlash and rejection from Russia as it is an arbitrary practice seriously encroaching on the legal interests of not only the DPRK but also Russia.
					
					 No matter what others may say, the DPRK-Russia economic cooperation including the service of the liner will steadily develop in keeping with the desire and common interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry General Director Meets Officials of European Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry General Director Meets Officials of European Organizations
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Son Kyong, general director of European Department 2 of the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK, met Gunnar Wiegand, managing director for Asia & the Pacific of the European External Action Service, on May 22. They discussed the DPRK-EU relations and exchanged views on the situation of the Korean peninsula.
					 The DPRK side informed the EU side of its stand on relations with it and emphasized that it is a priority for settling the issue of the Korean peninsula and defusing tension to terminate the U.S. nuclear threat and hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The EU side estimated the DPRK putting all-out efforts into implementing the five-year strategy for the country's economic development, stressing the principled stand of EU to develop economic relations with the DPRK.
					
					 And it said that the EU maintains the principle of settling all disputes through dialogues and negotiations, evincing the efforts to contribute to the peaceful settlement of the Korean peninsula issue.
					
					 Kim Son Kyong also met Nirj Deva, chairman of the Delegation for Relations with Korean Peninsula of the European Parliament, in Brussels.
					
					 The chairman said that they are well aware of lots of achievements made by the Korean people through active economic development based on science and technology, adding an issue of priority importance in defusing tension on the peninsula is to replace the armistice agreement with a peace pact.

articles.title: DPRK Minister of Public Health Exchange Opinions with Counterparts of Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Minister of Public Health Exchange Opinions with Counterparts of Different Countries
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The 70th World Health Assembly (WHA) began in Geneva on May 22. The assembly will last till May 31.
					 Participating in the WHA is a health delegation of the DPRK headed by Kang Ha Guk, minister of Public Health.
					
					 Before the opening of the WHA, Kang Ha Guk met his counterparts of Bhutan, Sri Lanka, Maldives and East Timor to exchange opinions on bilateral cooperation and international cooperation for development of health work. 
					
					 They appreciated the DPRK for developing with its own efforts and pursuing popular healthcare policies.

articles.title: KAPPC Spokesman Hits U.S. and Its Followers for Faulting DPRK's Measure for Self-defence
articles.content:
KAPPC Spokesman Hits U.S. and Its Followers for Faulting DPRK's Measure for Self-defence
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee (KAPPC) gave an answer to the question raised by KCNA Wednesday as regards the fact that the U.S. and its vassal forces are faulting the DPRK over its test-launch of ground-to-ground medium-to-long range strategic missile Pukguksong-2.
					 The U.S., browbeaten by the test-launch, called for "persisting economic and diplomatic pressure" while describing it as "disappointing and shocking." And Japan and other forces following the U.S. are calling the launch a "challenge to the world".
					
					 The south Korean authorities, too, are echoing the "chorus" of the hostile forces against the DPRK.
					
					 Deriding them, the spokesman said:
					
					 It is a normal work for national defence which the DPRKis obliged to do to bolster its nuclear deterrence, pursuant to the great line for simultaneous development of the two fronts to make serial and mass production of Juche weapons, including Pukguksong-2, for deployment at the strategic force units.
					
					 It is quite natural for the DPRK to bolster up the military capability for self-defence, now that the U.S. has become all the more undisguised in its attempt at preemptive attack and in nuclear war hysteria.
					
					 The hostile forces including the U.S. must clearly understand the immutable faith and annihilating spirit of Songun Korea possessed of nuclear sword of justice, and should not run amuck.
					
					 The south Korean authorities, in particular, should come to their senses as early as possible, clearly understanding that it is an act ignorant of what might defends the nation's dignity and sovereignty and guarantees the north-south relations for them to fault the DPRK's legitimate measures, dancing to the tune of outsiders.
					
					 As long as the U.S. and its vassal forces have become desperate in their moves to stifle the DPRK, we will further step up the efforts for diversifying and modernizing the nuclear force before the aggressors and provocateurs come to their senses.
					
					 The world will see with admiration how the DPRK makes more wonderful Juche weapons, nuclear attack means of Korean style which would strike terror into the hostile forces including the U.S.
					
					 The final victory belongs to the DPRK holding the treasured nuclear sword of justice.

articles.title: Congratulations to FM of Philippines
articles.content:
Congratulations to FM of Philippines
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho of the DPRK on May 17 sent a congratulatory message to Alan Peter Cayetano upon his appointment as foreign minister of Philippines.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger through close cooperation between the two foreign ministries and wished him success in his work.

articles.title: Greetings to Eritrean President
articles.content:
Greetings to Eritrean President
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Issaias Afewerki, president of Eritrea, on the 26th anniversary of its independence.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the common interests, the message wished the president of Eritrea bigger success in his work for development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK Gymnastics Players Back home
articles.content:
DPRK Gymnastics Players Back home
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- DPRK sportspersons came back home Wednesday after taking part in the 7th Gymnastics Asian Championships and the 14th Asian Juniors Gymnastics Championships held in Thailand.

articles.title: 20th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair
articles.content:
20th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The 20th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair (May 22-25) is going on in the DPRK.
					 Taking part in the fair are more than 200 companies from different countries and regions, which put on display electronic, machine, metal, building-material, medical and light industrial products, foodstuffs, consumer goods and others.
					
					 Masoud Dariani, import and export manager of the Iranian Namnik Co., told KCNA that it is the first time for him to participate in the fair.
					
					 He said that his company exhibits over 20 kinds of foodstuffs, hoping the fair would be a good occasion in promoting the economic exchange among countries. And he stressed that he would develop economic exchange with the DPRK.
					
					 Other foreign businessmen expressed their willingness to continue to participate in the fair, saying that it is an international economic gathering.
					
					 Pak Ung Sik, director of the Korean International Exhibition Corporation, said that its main theme is friendship, cooperation and common prosperity and development and it is expected to witness broad contacts and positive business among companies of the DPRK and other countries.

articles.title: 4th National Children's Football Tournament Opens
articles.content:
4th National Children's Football Tournament Opens
Sariwon, May 24 (KCNA) -- The 4th national children's football tournament was opened with due ceremony at the Sariwon Youth Stadium on Wednesday.
					 The tournament takes place on the occasion of the 71st anniversary of the foundation of the Korean Children's Union.
					
					 At least 350 football players (boys and girls) who proved successful at city and county games and provincial preliminaries will play league matches and semifinals. And the finals will be held at the Songdowon International Children's Camp.

articles.title: Care System for Children Established in DPRK
articles.content:
Care System for Children Established in DPRK
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A well-organized care system for children is established throughout the DPRK in which they are regarded as the kings of the country.
					 Kim Myong Chol, secretary of the Korean Association for Supporting the Children, told KCNA that in the DPRK children are left to the regular care of doctors at all hospitals, clinics, nurseries, kindergartens, schools and all-level hygienic and anti-epidemic centers.
					
					 Thanks to the care system, every child comes to have his or her own health record from birth and is provided with regular consultation and health checkup by district doctors, Kim said, and continued:
					
					 Children are also inoculated for epidemic diseases and get normal prophylactic treatment against rickets, TB, rheumatism and other diseases checking their growth.
					
					 And diverse activities have been carried out by the DPRK Red Cross Society and the Korean Association for Supporting the Children in cooperation with the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, WHO and UNICEF to improve their health and nutrition.
					
					 The head of a delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies working in the DPRK expressed willingness to make positive contribution to promoting the health of children at an event held in Pyongyang on May 22 to mark the Child Health Day.

articles.title: Participants in Int'l Trade Fair Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Participants in Int'l Trade Fair Visit Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Participants in the 20th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary career of the President and patriotic life of his family members at the old home, they looked round historic relics preserved with much care.

articles.title: Day of Torch for Increased Coal Production Drive Observed
articles.content:
Day of Torch for Increased Coal Production Drive Observed
Kaechon, May 24 (KCNA) -- The DPRK commemorated the 40th anniversary of torch ignited by leader Kim Jong Il for a patriotic drive of increased coal production.
					 In Juche 66 (1977) the leader took a step to spread the torch of socialist patriotic increased coal production drive, initiated by the members of the Phibada Guards of the Coal Production Workteam No. 1 of the Youth Production Pit of the Jagang Provincial Supply Coal Mine of the Kaechon Area Coal Mining Complex, to other coal mines across the country.
					
					 The members of the Phibada Guards, under his deep trust, additionally produced several thousand tons of coal in a little more than two months since the start of the drive and all workteams of the coal mine turned out 14 700 more tons of coal that year.
					
					 A commemorative meeting took place at the complex on Wednesday.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to British Prime Minister
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to British Prime Minister
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju sent a message of sympathy to British Prime Minister Theresa May on Wednesday as regards a terrorist suicidal bomb explosion in Manchester that caused heavy casualties.
					 Noting the Korean people are sharing the pain of loss with the British people, the message hoped that the British government and people would eradicate the aftermath of the terrorist incident as early as possible.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho also sent a similar message to his British counterpart Boris Johnson.

articles.title: Letters Sent by Kim Jong Il, Kim Jong Un to Chongryon Are Eternal Banners of Its Patriotic Cause: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Letters Sent by Kim Jong Il, Kim Jong Un to Chongryon Are Eternal Banners of Its Patriotic Cause: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent a letter "On Developing the Movement of Koreans in Japan onto a New, Higher Stage" to the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), on May 24, Juche 84 (1995) on the 40th anniversary of Chongryon and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un sent a letter "Let Us Usher in a New Golden Age of the Movement of Koreans in Japan True to the Intention of the Great Comrade Kim Jong Il" to Chongrhyon on May 25, Juche 104 (2015) on the 60th anniversary of Chongryon.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article says these letters are the most scientific and righteous programmes, which opened up a turning phase of the movement of Koreans in Japan and firmly guaranteed its rosy future, and a powerful ideo-theoretical weapon for the patriotic cause of Chongryon.
					
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The letters comprehensively indicate the main tasks for Chongryon to be always adhered to in its patriotic activities and ways to carry out them and fully demonstrated their truth and vitality in practices. 
					
					 The Juche-based idea of the overseas compatriots' movement of the peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu and their exploits are the immutable guidelines and eternal cornerstone of the movement of Koreans in Japan, and the historic letters of Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un serve as the eternal militant banners of the patriotic cause of Chongryon.
					
					 Unshakable are the faith and will of Chongryon officials and other Koreans in Japan to uphold for all ages President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who protected Chongryon and Koreans in Japan and victoriously led the movement of Koreans in Japan to the last moments of their great lives and to advance along the path of Juche, long patriotic path, true to the outstanding leadership of another peerlessly great man Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Nothing can block the vigorous advance of the Chongryon officials and other Koreans in Japan who have turned out in the drive to usher in a new golden age of the movement of Koreans in Japan under the banner of the letters of the peerlessly great men.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses CIA of Setting up Machine for Spying DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses CIA of Setting up Machine for Spying DPRK
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Days ago the CIA newly established the Korea Mission Centre to intensively deal with the "nuclear and ballistic missile threats" from the DPRK.
					 It is reported that the purpose of the establishment of the centre is to gather all the groups in different regions for spying on development of WMDs and chemical weapons for further effective and concentrated counteraction to "nuclear and missile threats from the DPRK."
					
					 Relevant officials of the U.S. Department of Defense said that the aim of establishment of the above-said centre in the U.S. forces in south Korea is to improve correctness of intelligence about north Korea and collect correct intelligence about the development of its nukes and ICBM, in particular. Meanwhile, south Korean puppet forces claim preoccupation of the U.S. is to collect intelligence about movement of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and its economy and people's living, what is happened inside it, strategic weapon study, etc.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The U.S. intention for spying on the DPRK by mobilizing all the intelligence agencies is the gravest challenge to the DPRK and open declaration of a war against it.
					
					 It is nonsensical for the U.S. to claim that spying is necessary to cope with "nuclear and missile threats" from the DPRK. 
					
					 Bolstering up war deterrence is the legitimate right of a sovereign state and no one can deprive it.
					
					 It is very foolish that the U.S. has an illusionary hope for intelligence agents to check the DPRK, much upset by its might of the military capability for self-defence being fully demonstrated in the world.
					
					 Although the CIA is going to use all intelligence agents in different parts of the world for spying on the DPRK, there is no room for them to stay in it.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Japanese Reactionaries for Their Childish Intention to Deny Past Crimes
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Japanese Reactionaries for Their Childish Intention to Deny Past Crimes
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the Japanese government expressed their stand that it would shelve the payment of financial contribution to the UNESCO this year.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is part of retaliatory measure for the UNESCO's reception of an application for the registration of the materials related to sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army as world record heritage by various civic organizations of south Korea, China, etc. This is also a dirty pressure on the UNESCO to change the UNESCO system for examination of the world record heritages in conformity with their taste at an early date.
					
					 It is aimed to persistently bar Japan's thrice-cursed crimes including sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army from being registered in the UNESCO and from being widely known to the world.
					
					 Japan invaded various Asian countries including Korea in the past and enslaved them and mercilessly killed them. These crimes were disclosed as hard crimes against humanity.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are pressurizing the UNESCO over the payment of a petty amount of money as they are afraid of such materials to be recognized internationally and known through UNESCO generation after generation.
					
					 Japan's invariable inveterate habit remains unchanged as it dislikes recognizing its wrongdoings and behaves impudently.
					
					 Money does not solve everything.
					
					 If the Japanese reactionaries make desperate efforts to deny their past wrongdoings with appeasement and pressure while showing off its wallet, this would fully reveal their childish intention as political profiteers.

articles.title: Military Nexus with U.S. Will Precipitate Japan's Doom: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Military Nexus with U.S. Will Precipitate Japan's Doom: Minju Joson
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- Japan recently agreed with the U.S. on deploying five U.S. Global Hawk drones in the Yokotami air force base. Drones and 12 F-16s launched a drill after being transferred from the U.S. mainland to the Kadena air force base in Okinawa. Meanwhile, Japan is mulling staging a joint naval drill with the U.S., the UK and France in the Western Pacific.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Wednesday says:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' tightened military cooperation with the U.S. constitutes a grave provocation to the sovereignty and security of the DPRK.
					
					 Their massive introduction of war hardware from the U.S. for getting frantic with war drills are not because of security concern of Japan.
					
					 It is the purpose of Japan to increase the capability of its "Self-Defence Forces" for preemptive attack and launch overseas invasion independently anytime.
					
					 The Korean peninsula is obviously its primary target. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries, seized with the wild ambition for revival of militarism and overseas invasion, are scheming to launch overseas invasion on the Korean peninsula which is close to Japan geographically and serves as a bridgehead and gateway to the continent.
					
					 But they were sadly mistaken.
					
					 The U.S. shield can never help Japan preserve its security. On the contrary, its military nexus with the U.S. will make it a big arsenal and lead it to self-destruction.
					
					 Japan had better behave with reason, pondering over the baneful consequences to be entailed by the military nexus with the U.S.

articles.title: Koreans in China Denounces Park Geun Hye Group
articles.content:
Koreans in China Denounces Park Geun Hye Group
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Liaoning Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China on May 20 issued a statement calling for sweeping away the Park Geun Hye group, worst conservative forces in the world.
					 The statement stressed the need to mercilessly smash the conservative forces, remnants of Park who have got hell-bent on sycophancy and treachery, confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north and hideous crimes and harmed the dignity of the nation and interests of the south Korean people.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Un's Assumption of Chairmanship of WPK Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Un's Assumption of Chairmanship of WPK Marked Abroad
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- There took place lecture, reading session, round-table talks, book and photo exhibition and film show in the Czech Republic, Mexico and Nigeria from April 27 to May 8 to mark the first anniversary of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's election as chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 On display at the venues were photos documenting revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on show were works of the peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu, and books and photos introducing the struggle of the army and people of the DPRK.
					
					 "Monument to Party Founding" and other Korean films were shown.
					
					 The vice-chairman of a county committee of the Communist Party of Czech and Moravia said Kim Jong Un's election as chairman of the WPK is an evident expression of the absolute support and trust of all the party members and other Koreans in him.
					
					 The chairman of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism read Kim Jong Un's Report to the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the Work of the Central Committee and detailed the achievements made by the Korean people in their efforts for building an economic power and improving the standard of people's living.
					
					 Figures of Nigeria said that the DPRK will surely emerge victorious in the confrontation with the U.S.

articles.title: Beninese Organizations Hail DPRK's Success in Test-Launch of Strategic Rocket
articles.content:
Beninese Organizations Hail DPRK's Success in Test-Launch of Strategic Rocket
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- The Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" and the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on May 16 to hail the successful test-launch of ground-to-ground medium-to-long range strategic ballistic rocket Hwasong-12.
					 The statement extended warm congratulations to the officials, scientists and technicians in the field of rocket research of the DPRK who manufactured the wonderful weapon system startling the world in a short span of time under the wise guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The great success of the test-launch means a great victory won by the Korean people, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK which ranked itself among the nuclear powers in name and reality will resolutely smash the despicable moves of the U.S. resorting to threat and blackmail by introducing nuclear and strategic weapons into the areas around the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The statement extended full support to the Korean people, convinced that they will surely emerge victorious in their just cause for reunifying Korea, rallied close around Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Koreans in China Slash at S. Korean Conservatives' Moves
articles.content:
Koreans in China Slash at S. Korean Conservatives' Moves
Pyongyang, May 24 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Federation of Korean Economic Workers in China on May 22 issued a statement stressing the need to give a crushing blow at Pak Geun Hye and the group of conservatives in south Korea.
					 The conservative group of south Korea is working hard to rally conservatives to seize power again, the statement said, adding:
					
					 What is more outrageous is that they frantically slander the DPRK, raising the liquidation of the "forces following the north" as a shield for rallying the conservatives.
					
					 All members of the federation, in close unity with the south Korean people and all overseas compatriots, will vigorously struggle to deal mercilessly crushing blows of history at Park and her conservative group and achieve the national reunification.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a Issaias Afewerki
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a Issaias Afewerki
Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 24 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente del Estado de Eritrea, Issaias Afewerki, con motivo del 26o aniversario de la independencia de ese pais.
					En su misiva, el remitente deseo al destinatario mayores exitos en sus labores para el desarrollo y progreso del pais y expreso la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran aun mas conforme a los intereses comunes.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju envia mensaje de consuelo a su homologa britanica
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju envia mensaje de consuelo a su homologa britanica
Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- En relacion con que fueron causadas las perdidas humanas por un incidente de terrorismo dinamitero en Manchester de Gran Bretana, el premier coreano Pak Pong Ju envio el dia 24 un mensaje de consuelo a su homologa britanica Theresa May. 
					El remitente senalo que el pueblo coreano comparte el dolor con el pueblo britanico y deseo que el gobierno y pueblo de Gran Bretana eliminen lo mas pronto posible las consecuencias del caso terrorista. 
					
					El mismo dia, el canciller coreano Ri Yong Ho tambien envio un mensaje de consuelo a su homologo Boris Johnson.

articles.title: Director del MINREX se reune con funcionarios de UE
articles.content:
Director del MINREX se reune con funcionarios de UE
Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- El titular de la Direccion No.2 de Europa del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Son Gyong, se reunio el dia 22 en la sede del Servicio Europeo de Accion Exterior con el director ejecutivo para Asia y el Pacifico, Gunnar Wiegand, para discutir el problema de relaciones RPDC-Union Europea e intercambiar las opiniones sobre la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					La parte coreana informo su posicion sobre las relaciones con la UE y enfatizo que acabar con la amenaza nuclear y la politica de hostilidad a la RPDC de EE.UU. es la prioridad para resolver el problema de la Peninsula Coreana y aliviar la situacion. 
					
					La parte de la UE dijo que es bueno que la RPDC se concentrara en el cumplimiento de la estrategia quinquenal para el desarrollo de la economia nacional y agrego que la UE mantiene la posicion de principios de desarrollar las relaciones economicas con la RPDC y resolver todos los conflictos mediante el dialogo y negociaciones.
					
					Aseguro que se esforzara por contribuir a la solucion pacifica del problema de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					El mismo dia, Kim departio en Bruselas con Nirj Deva, jefe de la delegacion del Parlamento Europeo para las relaciones con la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Nirj Deva apunto que conoce bien que el pueblo coreano alcanza muchos exitos al impulsar el desarrollo economico basandose en las ciencias y tecnicas y agrego que la tarea mas apremiante para relajar la tension de la Peninsula Coreana es sustituir el Acuerdo de Armisticio por el convenio de paz.

articles.title: CCPAP aboga por el lanzamiento de prueba de Pukguksong-2
articles.content:
CCPAP aboga por el lanzamiento de prueba de Pukguksong-2
Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que EE.UU. y sus satelites calumnian el lanzamiento de prueba del cohete balistico estrategico tierra-tierra de mediano y largo alcance Pukguksong-2 de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del Comite Coreano por la Paz de Asia y el Pacifico (CCPAP) dio el dia 24 la siguiente respuesta a la ACNC:
					Pasmado ante el lanzamiento de prueba de cohete balistico estrategico Pukguksong-2, EE.UU. dice que "es desesperante e impulsivo" y "continuara la presion economica y diplomatica". Al mismo tiempo, Japon y otras fuerzas satelites tambien lo califican como "desafio al mundo".

articles.title: En plena marcha XX exposicion internacional de mercancias de Pyongyang
articles.content:
En plena marcha XX exposicion internacional de mercancias de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 24 de mayo (ACNC) -- Transcurre en esta capital la XX Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Primaveral de Pyongyang (del 22 al 25 de mayo).
					En la ocasion participan mas de 200 companias comerciales de Corea y varios paises y regiones del mundo.
					
					Se exhibieron los productos electronicos hechos con ciencias y tecnologias avanzadas, las maquinas, materiales de construccion, medicinas y los articulos de los dominios de metalurgia, transporte, industria ligera y la alimentaria y de uso diario.
					
					En entrevista con la ACNC, el jefe del departamento de exportacion e importacion de la compania Namnik de Iran, Masoud Dariani, dijo que el participa por primera vez en esta feria y continuo:
					
					Nuestra compania expuso esta vez mas de una veintena de alimentos.
					
					Espero que la exposicion sea una buena oportunidad para estimular el intercambio economico y comercial entre los paises.
					
					Tomare parte activa en el intercambio economico con la RPDC.
					
					Otros empresarios extranjeros expresaron la voluntad de seguir participando en la exposicion diciendo que ella es la cita economica de dimension internacional que conviene a la aspiracion y deseo de la humanidad.
					
					El presidente de la Agencia de Exposiciones Internacionales de Corea, Pak Ung Sik, dijo que el tema principal de la feria es la amistad, cooperacion, prosperidad comun y desarrollo y aseguro que durante el evento, habra amplios contactos y transacciones comerciales entre la RPDC y las firmas extranjeras.
